intro: Secamone mombasica, commonly known as Mombasa secamone, is a flowering plant native to East Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a reddish tinge. It is often found in coastal forests and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
